intro: Senecio doeringii, commonly known as the Desert Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent leaves and a compact growth form to conserve water. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio doeringii is often found in rocky soils and is a common component of desert scrub ecosystems.
